treatment.description: Caudices to 10 dm × 2–6(–8) cm. Rosette leaf blades whitish or sometimes green, triangular-lanceolate, 6–25 × 1–3 cm, surfaces usually farinose. Inflorescences: floral shoots 2–7 dm × 5–15 mm; cyme often ± cylindric; branches 1–3 times bifurcate; cincinni mostly 3–8-flowered, mostly 1–5 cm. Corollas 14–23 mm diam. 2n = 34.
treatment.habitat: Cliffs and rocky slopes near sea
treatment.discussion: Subspecies insularis grows only on Santa Catalina and San Nicolas islands and on the mainland on sea bluffs at the south base of San Pedro Hill—a former island now connected by the alluvial Los Angeles Plain but related to Santa Catalina and San Clemente islands directly to the south (W. S. T. Smith 1900).
